intro: Sterigmostemum anchonioides, commonly known as the Anchonoid stemless plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with leaves arranged in a rosette formation near the base. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its specialized morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and evolution.
